intro: Cryptanthus boanovensis, commonly known as the "Bogotá carnation," is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It is a low-growing, mat-forming plant with dense, compact foliage that often forms a rosette. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
